intro: Gomphia subverticillata, commonly known as the clustered gomphia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae, which includes many grass-like plants adapted to arid and coastal environments. Gomphia subverticillata typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is well-suited to coastal and inland areas with low rainfall.
